Ishq ka Rang Safed is an Indian television drama series that premiered on 10th august on Colors TV. Rupali Guha and Susmita Bhattacharya created the series while Nitin Mahesh and Shahnawaz Khan directed it. The lead roles in the series are played by Eish Sing; who plays the role of Dhaani, Mishal Raheja; who plays the role of Viplav Tripathi, and Arun Bakshi; who plays the role of Dashrath Tripathi. 
For NRIs living in the United Kingdom, it is possible to catch the remainder of this captivating series in Catch up TV. 
The story revolves around the live of a young widow, Dhaani and a young man Viplav who falls in love with her and decides to go against all traditions, customs, and the orthodox views of his society in order to marry her. The English translation of the series is "White is the color of love," and as you will notice from the series, it is indeed. 
The series has become a favorite to many viewers because it does not represent normal story lines of family lives. Instead, this is a different story line, which causes the viewer to imagine why such a boy would go against popular believes, cancel engagement to his girlfriend in order to be married to a window. 
In the series, Viplav Tripathi is a carefree grandson of Dashrath Tripathi. While going to win a bet for his birthday from his friends one morning, on the banks of river Ganges, Tripathi meets a young widow Dhaani. As fate would have it, Dhaani lives with her mother in a widow refuge. Tripathi, who is an LL.B (lawyer), plans to go to the United States for further studies. However, before he could go, he plays some pranks on Dhaani, and when he realizes his mistakes goes on and apologizes to her. 
Things take a dramatic turn when his grandfather sends him to Delhi, while at the same time he tries to vacate the widows from the refuge center. Fortunately, Tripathi arrives and decides to defend the widows including Dhaani. 
You can follow this story on Colors TV and get to know why and what makes this love affair so unique. In the meantime, you can also watch other captivating Indian programs. Watch Hindi TV channels UK, and you will be surprised by the depth of emotions portrayed, as is the case in Ishq ka Rang Safed or plainly "White is the color of love."
